episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" features discussions on grief theories, a unique bus tour in Hong Kong designed for sleeping, the secret of British Army balloons known by a family from Alsace, and Orson Welles's use of prosthetic noses in films.

facts.fact: If you are having trouble with your grief it might be Bill Murray's fault.
There's a bus tour in Hong Kong which is specifically run for people to sleep all the way through.
For many years, the secret of the British Army's balloons was known by a single family of Alsatians.
Orson Welles's nose rarely made appearances in his movies.
